docs.title: gitzy CLI Documentation
docs.text:
Welcome to the gitzy CLI documentation!

  • Command Reference (auto-generated)
  • Add Command
  • Switch Command
  • List Command
  • Wipe Command

See the README for install and usage instructions, or view it on GitHub.

docs.title: 🛠️ Gitzy CLI Installation Guide
docs.text: Gitzy is a cross-platform CLI tool for switching between multiple Git credentials easily. This guide will help you download and install the latest release on Windows, Linux, or macOS.

docs.title: 📥 Step 1: Visit the GitHub Releases Page
docs.text:
1. Go to the Gitzy GitHub Releases page.
  2. Find the latest release at the top of the page.
  3. Download the appropriate ZIP file for your OS and architecture:
Platform File to Download Windows gitzy-windows-amd64.zip Linux gitzy-linux-amd64.zip macOS gitzy-darwin-amd64.zip

docs.title: 🪟 Windows Installation
docs.text:
1. Download & Extract:
  2. Download gitzy-windows-amd64.zip from the Releases page.

  3. Right-click the ZIP file and choose Extract All.

  4. Run the Installer:

  5. Inside the extracted folder, double-click install_windows.bat.

  6. This will copy gitzy.exe to a directory in your system PATH.

  7. Verify Installation: Open Command Prompt and run: cmd gitzy --help

docs.title: ✅ Manual Installation
docs.text:
1. Download & Extract bash wget https://github.com/yourusername/gitzy/releases/latest/download/gitzy-linux-amd64.zip unzip gitzy-linux-amd64.zip -d gitzy cd gitzy

  2. Run the installer bash chmod +x install_linux.sh ./install_linux.sh

  3. Verify installation bash gitzy --help

docs.title: gitzy
docs.text: Manage multiple GitHub identities and switch between them easily.

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text: gitzy is a cross-platform CLI for managing and switching between multiple GitHub identities.

docs.title: Options
docs.text:
--docs   Show embedded documentation
  -h, --help   help for gitzy

docs.title: SEE ALSO
docs.text:
• gitzy add - Add a new GitHub profile
  • gitzy doctor - Show troubleshooting info and embedded docs
  • gitzy list - List available profiles and show the active one
  • gitzy switch - Switch to a different GitHub profile
  • gitzy wipe - Irreversibly delete a profile (double-confirm!)

docs.title: gitzy add
docs.text: Add a new GitHub profile

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
Add a new GitHub profile to gitzy.

This command will interactively prompt you for user.name, user.email, and a GitHub token. It will store these in a new profile directory and optionally switch to it immediately.

Security note: The token is stored unencrypted. See GitHub token best practices.

gitzy add <profile> [flags]

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
# Add a new work profile
  gitzy add work

  # Add a personal profile
  gitzy add personal

docs.title: Options
docs.text: -h, --help   help for add

docs.title: Options inherited from parent commands
docs.text: --docs   Show embedded documentation

docs.title: SEE ALSO
docs.text: • gitzy - Manage multiple GitHub identities and switch between them easily.

docs.title: gitzy list
docs.text: List available profiles and show the active one

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
List all available gitzy profiles and indicate which one is currently active.

The active profile is detected by comparing the hashes of your current ~/.gitconfig and ~/.git-credentials with those stored in your profiles.

gitzy list [flags]

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
# List all profiles
  gitzy list

  # List all profiles in JSON format
  gitzy list --json

docs.title: Options
docs.text:
-h, --help   help for list
      --json   Output as JSON

docs.title: Options inherited from parent commands
docs.text: --docs   Show embedded documentation

docs.title: SEE ALSO
docs.text: • gitzy - Manage multiple GitHub identities and switch between them easily.

docs.title: gitzy switch
docs.text: Switch to a different GitHub profile

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
Switch to a different GitHub profile.

This command will backup your current ~/.gitconfig and ~/.git-credentials, then replace them with the files from the selected profile.

Backups are stored in ~/.gitzy/backups// for safety. 

gitzy switch <profile> [flags]

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
# Switch to the work profile
  gitzy switch work

  # Switch to the personal profile
  gitzy switch personal

docs.title: Options
docs.text: -h, --help   help for switch

docs.title: Options inherited from parent commands
docs.text: --docs   Show embedded documentation

docs.title: SEE ALSO
docs.text: • gitzy - Manage multiple GitHub identities and switch between them easily.

docs.title: gitzy wipe
docs.text: Irreversibly delete a profile (double-confirm!)

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
Irreversibly delete a gitzy profile.

This command will prompt you twice for confirmation before deleting the profile directory and removing it from the index. This action cannot be undone.

gitzy wipe <profile> [flags]

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
# Wipe the work profile
  gitzy wipe work

docs.title: Options
docs.text: -h, --help   help for wipe

docs.text: --docs   Show embedded documentation
